text:
Simon Robb for Metro.co.uk Tuesday 14 Feb 2017 5:19 pm Hans-Dieter Baumann appeared in court on child abuse charges (Picture: Joerg Bergmann/BILD) 
A man accused of abusing a 13-year-old girl more than 20 times appeared in court wearing a balaclava to conceal his identity. 
Hans-Dieter Baumann, 55, was also shackled when he stood trial on child abuse charges in Cottbus, eastern Germany. Who is this man seen walking away from where bodies of two girls were found? 
Suspects in Germany are often only identified in the media by their first name and the first letter of their surname. 
But in this instance, the defendant’s full name was given, so he was allowed to cover up his face, reports Mail Online . 
He was ordered to be shackled in court due to his violent past, which landed him in a psychiatric facility. The man was given permission to cover his face to protect his identity (Picture: Joerg Bergmann/BILD) He was also shackled due to his violent past (Picture: Joerg Bergmann/BILD) 
It was during this time he was able to gain access to the internet and dupe the ‘psychologically fragile’ girl into sex, the court heard. 
He allegedly abused her 23 more times in a hotel and open air sites. This tweet is coming back to haunt Donald Trump 
But Baumann denies the abuse and claimed he did nothing more than hold her hand. 
Defender David Schneider-Addael-Mensah brought along alleged love letters from the girl, adding: ‘There were no sexual acts between them. The state is mixing itself in a relationship that never was.’ 
Why Baumann was allowed to leave the psychiatric facility and meet the girl is yet to be made clear. 
The teenager is expected to testify in court on March 7. More
